title: Jean Dop
text:
Jean Dop (1924–2003) was a French professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s. A <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">France international</a> representative , he played club football for <a href="Marseille%20XIII">Marseille XIII</a>.
Dop featured in the <a href="1951%20French%20rugby%20league%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1951 French rugby league tour of Australia and New Zealand</a>, in place of injured scrum-half back <a href="Joseph%20Crespo">Joseph Crespo</a>. It was Les Chanticleers first such tour, but they lost only 4 of its 28 games, with Dop's dashing runs seen as instrumental in France's victory over <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> in the first <a href="Test%20match%20%28rugby%20league%29">Test</a>. Also during this tour in a match against South Auckland in New Zealand Dop was struck by a spectator. He later toured with France playing at . In 1988 he was inducted into the International <a href="Rugby%20League%20Hall%20of%20Fame">Rugby League Hall of Fame</a>.
